docs.lead_paragraph: Welcome to "Living Rooms," a new series on Opinionator. Read the editors' introduction to the series.
docs.abstract: Why it's hard to think of a cozy home as just a comfortable investment.
docs.snippet: Why it's hard to think of a cozy home as just a comfortable investment.

docs.lead_paragraph: A variety of consumer-focused articles appear daily in The New York Times and online in our blogs. Each weekday morning, we gather them together here so you can quickly scan the news that could hit your wallet.

headline.main: Monday Reading: The Costs of Raising a Child

docs.abstract: The costs of raising a child, how baseball game ticket prices are becoming adjustable and other consumer-focused items from Monday's Times.
docs.snippet: The costs of raising a child, how baseball game ticket prices are becoming adjustable and other consumer-focused items from Monday's Times.

headline.main: Readers Take Movies and Twist the Plots

docs.abstract: Readers offered any number of alternative plot lines to make classic movies set in New York City just a little more feel-good.
docs.snippet: Readers offered any number of alternative plot lines to make classic movies set in New York City just a little more feel-good.

headline.main: Must Plans Cover Maternity Services for Adult Children?

docs.abstract: Federal law requires companies with 15 or more workers to cover maternity benefits if they cover other health benefits -- but there's an exception for "non-spouse dependents," including adult children.
docs.snippet: Federal law requires companies with 15 or more workers to cover maternity benefits if they cover other health benefits -- but there's an exception for "non-spouse dependents," including adult children.

docs.lead_paragraph: On most cable newscasts, the people who are writing new financial regulations are called congressmen, Brian Stelter writes in The New York Times. But on "The Dylan Ratigan Show" on MSNBC, some are called "banksters."

headline.main: From CNBC Stock-Picker to Bank Critic on MSNBC

docs.abstract: Until fairly recently, Dylan Ratigan hosted a stock-picking show. Now he rails against the "vampire" banks who "have assumed control of our government."
docs.snippet: Until fairly recently, Dylan Ratigan hosted a stock-picking show. Now he rails against the "vampire" banks who "have assumed control of our government."

docs.lead_paragraph: The film "2001: A Space Odyssey" presents a dramatic vision of the future, where sentient robots double as secretaries, performing daily tasks and simple services for their human masters.
docs.abstract: SRI International, whose work led to the computer mouse, has set its sights on the mobile phone and Web market.
docs.snippet: SRI International, whose work led to the computer mouse, has set its sights on the mobile phone and Web market.
